title: Changelog
text: notable changes project documented file. format based Keep Changelog, project adheres Semantic Versioning.

title: Changelog
text: Added theme_sci(), derivative theme_charite() publications journals Added vignette installation instructions computers proxies Added message informing saved figure size nice_save() Extended workflow documentation README highlighting use custom fonts Updated colour palette names Updated function descriptions functions

title: Changelog
text: Fixed font warning theme_charite() remain silent default “sans” used Fixed default background colour legend theme_charité, now transparent like plot Fixed scaling legend keys theme_charite()

title: Changelog
text: nice_save() now supports manual height/width overrides. theme_charite() accepts custom font families. preview_charite_palettes() can now show continuous gradients. “berryseason” new color palette charite_palettes

title: Changelog
text: .svg export error caused fill = NA element_rect(). Plot dimensions accurately calculated nice_save(). Plots can now saved transparent background.

title: Changelog
text: Added charite_palettes make_charite_palette() custom color interpolation. Added scale_fill_charite() scale_color_charite(). Added nice_save() optimized plot rendering

title: Changelog
text: New theme theme_charite() aligned Charité visual identity. Charité visual identity colors charite_colors Example plot example_plot() Easter egg virchow() function Dummy data curves.rda test plots

title: Installing Packages
text: charite minimal R package custom ggplot2 theme, colour palettes styled match visual identity Charité – Universitätsmedizin Berlin publication-ready plot rendering. package developed Johannes Julius Mohn. can install package directly GitHub.
code: # install.packages("devtools") # install `devtools` if not yet available devtools::install_github("johannesjuliusm/charite")

title: Installing Packages
text: working computer proxies, installation requires little workaround. proxy intermediary server handles internet traffic. setup common corporate, university, government networks internet access controlled filtered. Go GitHub page download package tarball (.tar.gz) Releases tab navigation pane right. Unzip file chosen location computer, e.g., Downloads folder, install package source.
code: # install `charite` from tarball # replace with your path install.packages("~/Downloads/charite_0.4.0.tar.gz", repos = NULL, type = "source")

what: Working on a computer with proxies
title: Installing Packages
text: charite requires ggplot2, svglite, grid, grDevices packages. install CRAN, simply use install.packages("packageName"). install R packages machine behind proxy, first need configure proxy settings R can connect CRAN GitHub . set, RStudio go Tools > Global Options > Packages untick “Use Internet Explorer library/proxy HTTP” restart R session. Note option may longer available latest versions R/RStudio. Instead, try downloading installing packages using wininet (Windows ) libcurl.
code:
# create or write to existing .Rprofile path2rprofile <- file.path(Sys.getenv("HOME"), ".Rprofile") file.edit(path2rprofile)  # set proxies # if your proxy requires authentication, use username:password@proxy.charite.de:8080 cat('Sys.setenv(http_proxy = "http://proxy.charite.de:8080")
',     'Sys.setenv(https_proxy = "http://proxy.charite.de:8080")
',     file = path2rprofile,     append = TRUE)  # reload the .Rprofile settings source(path2rprofile) # use "wininet" (a Windows-specific internet method) when installing a package install.packages("packageName", method = "wininet")  # make this option permanent by saving it to your .Rprofile cat('options(download.file.method = "wininet")
',      file = file.path(Sys.getenv("HOME"), ".Rprofile"),     append = TRUE)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Johannes Julius Mohn. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Mohn JJ (2025). charite: ggplot2 theme plotting tools Charité corporate identity. R package version 0.4.0, https://github.com/johannesjuliusm/charite, https://johannesjuliusm.github.io/charite.
code: @Manual{,   title = {charite: A ggplot2 theme and plotting tools for the Charité corporate identity},   author = {Johannes Julius Mohn},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.4.0, https://github.com/johannesjuliusm/charite},   url = {https://johannesjuliusm.github.io/charite}, }

what: A ggplot2 theme and plotting tools for the Charité corporate identity
title: A ggplot2 theme and plotting tools for the Charité corporate identity
text: minimal R package Charité-styled ggplot2 theme, visual identity colour palettes, publication-ready figure export manuscripts slides.

title: A ggplot2 theme and plotting tools for the Charité corporate identity
text: can install development version charite GitHub : install package machine proxies, e.g., standard Windows PC Charité network, find detailed installation instructions installation vignette.
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("johannesjuliusm/charite")

title: A ggplot2 theme and plotting tools for the Charité corporate identity
text: Visualize data theme_charite() match corporate style.  Preview available colour palettes.

title: A ggplot2 theme and plotting tools for the Charité corporate identity
code: # create your ggplot2 figure p <- ggplot(data, aes(x = x, y = y)) +         geom_point(size = 3, color = charite_colors$HIMBEER) # use any of the Charité colors          # format the plot style p <- p + theme_charite()  # alternatively, customize the plot style further # for example by specifying a font p <- p + theme_charite(font = "Charité Text Office")  # easily save your plot in a format optimized for slides and publications nice_save("myfigure.png", p, layout = "slides")

title: A ggplot2 theme and plotting tools for the Charité corporate identity
text: theme_charite() – custom ggplot2 theme charite_colors – Named list hex codes Charité visual identity colours charite_palettes – Named list colour palettes derived Charité visual identity colour scheme preview_charite_palettes() – Shows available colour palettes colour swatches nice_save() – ggsave wrapper defaults ideal high-res figures publication scale_color_charite() – ggplot2 colour scale using palettes charite_palettes scale_fill_charite() – ggplot2 fill scale using palettes charite_palettes example_plot() – Generates demo plot make_charite_palette() – Internal function interpolate reverse colour palettes virchow() – Surprise console ASCII art. Use fun curves – Included dataset time series curves demo plot

title: A ggplot2 theme and plotting tools for the Charité corporate identity
text: Developed Johannes Julius MohnMax Planck School Cognition & Charité – Universitätsmedizin Berlin Report bugs . Get touch via johannes.mohn@charite.de

title: A ggplot2 theme and plotting tools for the Charité corporate identity
text: use package work publication, please acknowledge author.Example: “figures generated using custom theme charite R package Johannes Julius Mohn (https://github.com/johannesjuliusm/charite).”

title: Hex code color definitions of the official Charite visual identity color scheme — charite_colors
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(as.data.frame(x = 2, y = 6), aes(x = 2, y = 6)) +     geom_point(size = 16, color = charite_colors$LILA) +     theme_charite()

what: Interpolation or reversion of a Charite color palette — make_charite_palette
title: Interpolation or reversion of a Charite color palette — make_charite_palette
text: Internal function use color palettes continuous data many categories required. function can used create custom color palette.

title: Interpolation or reversion of a Charite color palette — make_charite_palette
code: make_charite_palette(palette = "primary", reverse = FALSE, ...)

title: Interpolation or reversion of a Charite color palette — make_charite_palette
text: palette Character name palette `charite_palettes custom vector hex codes reverse Boolean indicating whether palette reversed ... Additional arguments passed grDevices::colorRampPalette()

title: Interpolation or reversion of a Charite color palette — make_charite_palette
text: function takes integer n returns n interpolated colors

title: Interpolation or reversion of a Charite color palette — make_charite_palette
code: pal <- make_charite_palette("goldelse") pal(5) #> [1] "#FAB600" "#DCD91D" "#81BE71" "#1E90AC" "#564091" pal_rev <- make_charite_palette("mono", reverse = TRUE) pal_rev(10) #>  [1] "#CBCFD2" "#B9BFC3" "#A8AFB4" "#97A0A5" "#869096" "#70797F" "#545B5F" #>  [8] "#383C3F" "#1C1E1F" "#000000"

what: High-resolution (300dpi) figure export for publications and slides — nice_save
title: High-resolution (300dpi) figure export for publications and slides — nice_save
text: wrapper around ggplot2::ggsave() saves plots layout profiles optimized slides publications.

title: High-resolution (300dpi) figure export for publications and slides — nice_save
code: nice_save(   filename,   plot = ggplot2::last_plot(),   layout = c("full col", "half col", "tiny", "full page", "slides"),   custom = NULL,   ... )

title: High-resolution (300dpi) figure export for publications and slides — nice_save
text: filename Name file save. end .png, .tiff, .svg, etc. plot ggplot object. omitted, uses last plot. layout One : "full col", "half col", "tiny", "full page", "slides". custom vector width height inches. specified, override layout ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::ggsave().

title: High-resolution (300dpi) figure export for publications and slides — nice_save
text: Saves plot returns filename (invisibly).

title: High-resolution (300dpi) figure export for publications and slides — nice_save
text: Supported layouts: "full col" (3.5 ): Standard full-column publication figure "half col" (1.8 ): Half-width column figure "tiny"     (1 ): compact sub-figures thumbnails "full page" (7 ): Full-page width figure "slides"   (4.5 height): presentation slides optimal rendering, adjust font_size theme_charite() control sizes margins plot. Recommended sizes: 6 8 pt plots, 6 pt smaller "tiny" plots; 10 12 pt "slides". Plots rendered theme_charite() transparent backgrounds. may override bg = "white". Saving .svg requires svglite package.

title: High-resolution (300dpi) figure export for publications and slides — nice_save
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ nice_save("example.png", example_plot()) } # }

title: Preview available color palettes — preview_charite_palettes
text: Displays color palettes defined charite_palettes color swatches. Toggle viewing palettes discrete colors continuous gradients.

title: Preview available color palettes — preview_charite_palettes
code: preview_charite_palettes(type = c("discrete", "continuous"))

title: Preview available color palettes — preview_charite_palettes
text: type Character; either "discrete" "continuous". Defaults "discrete".

title: Preview available color palettes — preview_charite_palettes
code: preview_charite_palettes()  preview_charite_palettes(type = "continuous")

what: Charite color scale for ggplot2 — scale_color_charite
title: Charite color scale for ggplot2 — scale_color_charite
text: Applies ggplot2 color scale using one custom color palettes charite_palettes

title: Charite color scale for ggplot2 — scale_color_charite
code: scale_color_charite(palette = "primary", discrete = TRUE, reverse = FALSE, ...)

title: Charite color scale for ggplot2 — scale_color_charite
text: palette Character name palette charite_palettes discrete Logical. palette use discrete color steps? reverse Logical. palette reversed? ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::discrete_scale()

title: Charite color scale for ggplot2 — scale_color_charite
text: ggplot2 scale object

title: Charite color scale for ggplot2 — scale_color_charite
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, cyl, color = mpg)) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_color_charite("berryseason", discrete = FALSE) +   theme_charite()   ggplot(mtcars, aes(factor(cyl), color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point(size = 5, stat = "count") +   scale_color_charite("secondary") +   theme_charite()

code: scale_fill_charite(palette = "primary", discrete = TRUE, reverse = FALSE, ...)

title: Charite fill scale for ggplot2 — scale_fill_charite
text: palette Character name palette charite_palettes discrete Logical. palette use discrete color steps? reverse Logical. palette reversed? ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::discrete_scale()

title: Charite fill scale for ggplot2 — scale_fill_charite
text: ggplot2 scale object

title: Charite fill scale for ggplot2 — scale_fill_charite
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(mtcars, aes(factor(cyl), fill = factor(cyl))) +   geom_bar() +   scale_fill_charite("goldelse") +   theme_charite()

what: A custom ggplot2 theme for Charite – Universitaetsmedizin Berlin by Johannes Julius Mohn — theme_charite
title: A custom ggplot2 theme for Charite – Universitaetsmedizin Berlin by Johannes Julius Mohn — theme_charite
text: function creates custom ggplot2 theme customizable options font, line thickness, grid, plot panel aspect ratio, margins.

title: A custom ggplot2 theme for Charite – Universitaetsmedizin Berlin by Johannes Julius Mohn — theme_charite
code: theme_charite(   font_size = 8,   thickness = 0.5,   font = "sans",   grid = FALSE,   aspect_ratio = 3/4,   tiny_margins = FALSE,   legend_key_size = NULL,   debug_area = FALSE )

title: A custom ggplot2 theme for Charite – Universitaetsmedizin Berlin by Johannes Julius Mohn — theme_charite
text: font_size Base font size points like favourite text editor. thickness Line thickness axes. Default ggplot2 setting 0.5. font Character string font family. Defaults "sans" (ggplot2 default). Common alternatives: "Arial" "Helvetica" publications; "Calibri" suggested Charite corporate identity; "Times New Roman", timeless serif font. Note fonts must installed OS used. grid Logical; TRUE, grid lines added. aspect_ratio Aspect ratio plot panel (y:x axis). Default 3:4. tiny_margins Logical; TRUE, margins objects around plot panel minimized. Font rendering may depend system output format (PDF, PNG, SVG). legend_key_size Size legend keys. Scales font_size default. debug_area Visualize plot margins plot size debugging. Defaults FALSE.

title: A custom ggplot2 theme for Charite – Universitaetsmedizin Berlin by Johannes Julius Mohn — theme_charite
text: ggplot2 theme

title: A custom ggplot2 theme for Charite – Universitaetsmedizin Berlin by Johannes Julius Mohn — theme_charite
text: use specific font, must installed operating system. Common fonts figures include: "Arial" "Helvetica" publications slides; "Calibri" suggested Charite corporate identity. "Times New Roman" contexts legibility aided using serif font.

title: A custom ggplot2 theme for Charite – Universitaetsmedizin Berlin by Johannes Julius Mohn — theme_charite
code: library(ggplot2) p <- ggplot(ChickWeight, aes(x = Time, y = weight, color = weight)) +        geom_point(size = 3) +        scale_color_charite("goldelse", discrete = FALSE) +        theme_charite()

what: A custom ggplot2 theme for scientific publications by Johannes Julius Mohn — theme_sci
title: A custom ggplot2 theme for scientific publications by Johannes Julius Mohn — theme_sci
text: function creates custom ggplot2 theme customizable options font, line thickness, grid, plot panel aspect ratio, margins.

title: A custom ggplot2 theme for scientific publications by Johannes Julius Mohn — theme_sci
code: theme_sci(   font_size = 8,   thickness = 0.5,   font = "sans",   grid = FALSE,   aspect_ratio = 1,   tiny_margins = FALSE,   legend_key_size = NULL,   debug_area = FALSE )

title: A custom ggplot2 theme for scientific publications by Johannes Julius Mohn — theme_sci
text: font_size Base font size points like favourite text editor. thickness Line thickness axes. Default ggplot2 setting 0.5. font Character string font family. Defaults "sans". grid Logical; TRUE, grid lines added. aspect_ratio Aspect ratio plot panel (y:x axis). Default 1:1. tiny_margins Logical; TRUE, margins objects around plot panel minimized. Font rendering may depend system output format (PDF, PNG, SVG). legend_key_size Size legend keys. Scales font_size default. debug_area Visualize plot margins plot size debugging. Defaults FALSE.

title: A custom ggplot2 theme for scientific publications by Johannes Julius Mohn — theme_sci
text: ggplot2 theme

title: A custom ggplot2 theme for scientific publications by Johannes Julius Mohn — theme_sci
text: use specific font, must installed operating system.

title: A custom ggplot2 theme for scientific publications by Johannes Julius Mohn — theme_sci
code: library(ggplot2) p <- ggplot(ChickWeight, aes(x = Time, y = weight)) +        geom_point() + theme_sci()
